intro: Baccaurea borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean baccaurea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically orange to red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
